attributes.action: Stop the deportation and processing of refugees in Rwanda
attributes.additional_details:
The government has to take a step back and re-evaluate if this the right course of action. 

The governments taken a person's basic human right to freedom from persecution and protection.

Amnesty International UK’s refugee and migrant rights director, noted Rwanda had a “dismal human rights record”.

https://www.hrw.org/africa/rwanda
attributes.background:
The government has announce a multimillion-pound plan for asylum seekers who cross the Channel in small boats to be flown for processing to Rwanda. 

The estimated cost is “about £120m” and has followed nine months of negotiation with the Rwandan government.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614913
